result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott A. Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott A. Miller is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott A. Miller was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 3 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Domestic Violence Surcharge ($100  ea applicable count).
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Deft may only have contact with Brenda Howe as permitted by the court/agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Brenda Howe without her permission and permission of the agent.
*  Previously ordered fines & costs are reimposed.
Fine/costs were previously paid with bond on deposit - Zero Balance.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Gregory Bates.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:37pm-  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 25 months:  13 months initial confinement & 12 months extended supervision w/ conditions.  Credit for 174 days.  Any previously ordered fines & costs are reimposed.  DNA surcharge ordered.  DE is eligible for CIP & SAP.  Appeal rights given.

Defendant, Scott A. Miller, appeared with Attorney Angela Komp.  Attorney Tracey Lynn Braun appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Angela Komp.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  3:45pm-  Matter heard with 14CF1045.  Victim rights compliance.  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of no contest to count 1; found guilty by the court.
